channel.title: Brandon Boswell
channel.description: Recent content from Brandon Boswell's Digital Garden

item.title: One Sec
item.description: $19 dollars a year to be more aware of when I am leaking time on Time Sinks. Cancelled on 2022-04-25. Had signed up for a year subscription to try it out.
item.content:encoded:
$19 dollars a year to be more aware of when I am leaking time on Time Sinks.

Cancelled on 2022-04-25. Had signed up for a year subscription to try it out. Turns out I found it incredibly annoying, and I’ve instead adopted the principle to set a 5-minute timer to remind myself to get off of whatever app I was on. That was the piece I really enjoyed, and it can be accomplished with a simple Shortcut flow on iOS (similar to what the app uses).

All in all, it was worth it because it showed me how useful that notification can be and how to use app launching intercepts to do interesting actions on iOS.

item.title: Obsidian
item.description: The application I’m writing in at the moment. This is the source of this blog / Digital Garden. I recorded a video of how I use Obsidian at: How I Use Obsidian
item.content:encoded:
The application I’m writing in at the moment. This is the source of this blog / Digital Garden.

I recorded a video of how I use Obsidian at: How I Use Obsidian

How I use statuses in Obsidian: Obsidian Statuses

For more tips on Obsidian, go check out: https://github.com/kmaasrud/awesome-obsidian

Tips

  • Open the Link under your cursor with CMD+OPT+ENTER

item.title: VIM
item.description: Getting started: https://coderwall.com/p/adv71w/basic-vim-commands-for-getting-started Watching the Thoughtbot training for VIM this dug into f and t for finding a specific character. F will land on it. T will land just prior to it Capital F and Capital T do the same, but in reverse Semicolon repeats Use / for searching.
item.content:encoded:
Getting started: https://coderwall.com/p/adv71w/basic-vim-commands-for-getting-started

Watching the Thoughtbot training for VIM this dug into f and t for finding a specific character. F will land on it. T will land just prior to it Capital F and Capital T do the same, but in reverse Semicolon repeats Use / for searching. Use n to go to the next result and shift N to go to the previous https://thoughtbot.com/upcase/videos/onramp-to-vim-motions-and-moving

D,A,W to delete the current word including the (delete a word) If you don’t want to lose the space use D,I,W for (delete inner word)

You can do this same thing with paragraphs (contiguous lines) by using the P operator. Ex: >,I,P to indent an entire paragraph

Use CC to empty the current line and begin to replace the contents of that line Use DD to remove the entire line

CIW to swapping out this word with a completely new one From this course I learned that I need to use shift on my right hand more. I apparently predominantly manage shift with my right hand, but that makes pressing characters like " difficult as I have to completely leave the home row. They give you a shift on both sides for a reason.

The period key lets you repeat the last command.

The Great Vim Cheat Sheet https://vimsheet.com/

https://vimsheet.com/
